00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 webwork2/clients/renderProblem.pl
00022 
00023 This script will take a file and send it to a WeBWorK daemon webservice
00024 to have it rendered.  The result is split into the basic HTML rendering
00025 and evaluation of answers and then passed to a browser for printing.
00026 
00027 The formatting allows the browser presentation to be interactive with the 
00028 daemon running the script webwork2/lib/renderViaXMLRPC.pm
00029 
00030 Rembember to configure the local output file and display command !!!!!!!!
00031 
00032 =cut
00033 
00034 use strict;
00035 use warnings;
00036 
00037 
00038

00040 #  configuration section for client

00044 use lib '/opt/webwork/webwork2/lib';
00045 #use Crypt::SSLeay;  # needed for https
00046 use WebworkClient;

00050 # Configure

00053  ############################################################
00054 # configure the local output file and display command !!!!!!!!
00055  ############################################################
00056  
00057 use constant LOG_FILE => '/opt/webwork/libraries/t/bad_problems.txt';
00058 
00059 use constant DISPLAYMODE   => 'images'; #  jsMath  is another possibilities.
00060 
00061  # Path to a temporary file for storing the output of renderProblem.pl
00062 # use constant  TEMPOUTPUTFILE   => '/Users/gage/Desktop/renderProblemOutput.html'; 
00063  
00064  # Command line for displaying the temporary file in a browser.
00065  #use constant  DISPLAY_COMMAND  => 'open -a firefox ';   #browser opens tempoutputfile above
00066  # use constant  DISPLAY_COMMAND  => "open -a 'Google Chrome' ";
00067    use constant DISPLAY_COMMAND => " less ";   # display tempoutputfile with less
00068  ############################################################
00069  
00070  my $use_site;
00071  $use_site = 'test_webwork';    # select a rendering site 
00072  #$use_site = 'local';           # select a rendering site 
00073  #$use_site = 'rochester_test';  # select a rendering site 
00074  
00075  
00076  ############################################################
00077  
00078 # To configure the target webwork server
00079 # two URLs are required
00080 # 1. $XML_URL   http://test.webwork.maa.org/mod_xmlrpc
00081 #    points to the Webservice.pm and Webservice/RenderProblem modules
00082 #    Is used by the client to send the original XML request to the webservice
00083 #
00084 # 2. $FORM_ACTION_URL      http:http://test.webwork.maa.org/webwork2/html2xml
00085 #    points to the renderViaXMLRPC.pm module.
00086 #
00087 #     This url is placed as form action url when the rendered HTML from the original
00088 #     request is returned to the client from Webservice/RenderProblem. The client
00089 #     reorganizes the XML it receives into an HTML page (with a WeBWorK form) and 
00090 #     pipes it through a local browser.
00091 #
00092 #     The browser uses this url to resubmit the problem (with answers) via the standard
00093 #     HTML webform used by WeBWorK to the renderViaXMLRPC.pm handler.  
00094 #
00095 #     This renderViaXMLRPC.pm handler acts as an intermediary between the browser 
00096 #     and the webservice.  It interprets the HTML form sent by the browser, 
00097 #     rewrites the form data in XML format, submits it to the WebworkWebservice.pm 
00098 #     which processes it and sends the the resulting HTML back to renderViaXMLRPC.pm
00099 #     which in turn passes it back to the browser.
00100 # 3.  The second time a problem is submitted renderViaXMLRPC.pm receives the WeBWorK form 
00101 #     submitted directly by the browser.  
00102 #     The renderViaXMLRPC.pm translates the WeBWorK form, has it processes by the webservice
00103 #     and returns the result to the browser. 
00104 #     The The client renderProblem.pl script is no longer involved.
00105 # 4.  Summary: renderProblem.pl is only involved in the first round trip
00106 #     of the submitted problem.  After that the communication is  between the browser and
00107 #     renderViaXMLRPC using HTML forms and between renderViaXMLRPC and the WebworkWebservice.pm
00108 #     module using XML_RPC.
00109 # 5.  The XML_PASSWORD is defined on the site.  In future versions a more secure password method
00110 #     may be implemented.  This is sufficient to keep out robots.
00111 # 6.  The course "daemon_course" must be a course that has been created on the server or an error will
00112 #     result. A different name can be used but the course must exist on the server.
00113 
00114 
00115 our ( $XML_URL,$FORM_ACTION_URL, $XML_PASSWORD, $XML_COURSE);
00116 if ($use_site eq 'local') {
00117 # the rest can work!!
00118     $XML_URL      =  'http://localhost:80';
00119     $FORM_ACTION_URL  =  'http://localhost:80/webwork2/html2xml';
00120     $XML_PASSWORD     =  'xmlwebwork';
00121     $XML_COURSE       =  'daemon_course';
00122 } elsif ($use_site eq 'rochester_test') {  
00123     
00124     $XML_URL      =  'http://128.151.231.2';
00125     $FORM_ACTION_URL  =  'http://128.151.231.2/webwork2/html2xml';
00126     $XML_PASSWORD     = 'xmlwebwork';
00127     $XML_COURSE       = 'daemon_course';
00128     
00129 } elsif ($use_site eq 'test_webwork') {
00130 
00131     $XML_URL      =  'https://test.webwork.maa.org';
00132     $FORM_ACTION_URL  =  'https://test.webwork.maa.org/webwork2/html2xml';
00133     $XML_PASSWORD     = 'xmlwebwork';
00134     $XML_COURSE       = 'daemon_course';
00135 
00136 }

00154 our $xmlrpc_client = new WebworkClient;
00155 
00156 ##################################################
00157 # input/output section
00158 ##################################################
00159 
00160 
00161 $xmlrpc_client->url($XML_URL);
00162 $xmlrpc_client->{form_action_url}= $FORM_ACTION_URL;
00163 $xmlrpc_client->{displayMode}   = DISPLAYMODE();
00164 $xmlrpc_client->{user}          = 'xmluser';
00165 $xmlrpc_client->{password}      = $XML_PASSWORD;
00166 $xmlrpc_client->{course}        = $XML_COURSE;
00167 
00168 our $source = '';
00169 our $output;
00170 our $return_string;
00171 if (@ARGV) {
00172     local(*FH);
00173     open(FH, ">>".LOG_FILE()) || die "Can't open log file ". LOG_FILE();
00174     $source = (defined $ARGV[0]) ? `cat $ARGV[0]` : '' ;
00175     $xmlrpc_client->encodeSource($source);
00176     if ( $xmlrpc_client->xmlrpcCall('renderProblem') )    {
00177             $output = $xmlrpc_client->{output};
00178         if (defined($output->{flags}->{error_flag}) and $output->{flags}->{error_flag} ) {
00179             $return_string = "0\t $ARGV[0] has errors\n";
00180         } elsif (defined($output->{errors}) and $output->{errors} ){
00181             $return_string = "0\t $ARGV[0] has syntax errors\n";
00182         } else {
00183             # 
00184             if (defined($output->{flags}->{DEBUG_messages}) ) {
00185                 my @debug_messages = @{$output->{flags}->{DEBUG_messages}};
00186                 $return_string .= (pop @debug_messages ) ||'' ; #avoid error if array was empty
00187                 if (@debug_messages) {
00188                     $return_string .= join(" ", @debug_messages);
00189         } else {
00190                     $return_string = "";
00191         }
00192             }
00193             if (defined($output->{flags}->{WARNING_messages}) ) {
00194                 my @warning_messages = @{$output->{flags}->{WARNING_messages}};
00195                 $return_string .= (pop @warning_messages)||''; #avoid error if array was empty
00196                     $@=undef;
00197                 if (@warning_messages) {
00198                     $return_string .= join(" ", @warning_messages);
00199     } else {
00200                     $return_string = "";
00201                 }
00202     }
00203             $return_string = "0\t ".$return_string."\n" if $return_string;   # add a 0 if there was an warning or debug message.
00204         }
00205         unless ($return_string) {
00206             $return_string = "1\t $ARGV[0] is ok\n";
00207         }
00208     } else {
00209         
00210         $return_string = "0\t $ARGV[0] has undetermined errors -- could not be read perhaps?\n";
00211     }
00212     print FH $return_string;
00213     close(FH);
00214 } else {
00215     print "0 $ARGV[0]  something went wrong -- could not render file\n";
00216     print STDERR "Useage: ./checkProblem.pl    [file_name]\n";
00217     print STDERR "For example: ./checkProblem.pl    input.txt\n";
00218     print STDERR "Output is sent to the log file: ",LOG_FILE();
00219     
00220 }
